result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard D Lefevre

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:04 AM Defendant Richard D LeFevre in court.  Attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf Esq in court for Richard D LeFevre. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense states he has been in contact with response DA re: proof issue as it relates to test result on 21CF1792 and how it would impact a global offer. 

State requests more time to speak to analyst on 21CF1792. State will be trying to make contact again today.
Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:15 AM Defendant Richard D Lefevre in court.  Attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf Esq in court for Richard D Lefevre. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 

Case called for bail/bond hearing. 

Defense makes arguments in support of Motion for Amendment of Bail Conditions to remove ignition interlock requirement (as it relates to 21CF1038 and 21CF1792). 
State makes arguments in opposition to any bail modification. 

For reasons stated on the record the court will deny the motion for bail modification. 

09/26/2022 hearing to remain as set.
Bail/bond hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Modify Bail, filed by Atty Raskopf
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard D Lefevre in court.  Attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf Esq in court for Richard D Lefevre. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Date before the Trial Court shall remain as previously set.
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Attorney request to adjourn Preliminary Hearing
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 07-20-2022. "Granted if there is a letter on file waiving the time limits. No Marsy's Law issue."
Attorney Eric Raskopf

Waiver of Prelim on July 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
**Rescheduled due to a conflict with the Court's Calendar.**
Treatment Letter filed on half of the defendant by Alliance Counseling Center.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Richard D Lefevre in court with attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf.   
Court to Address:  State's Motion For DeNovo Review of Bail (Requesting the court impose cash bail).

State relies on the written submission - no further arguments presented.
Attorney Raskopf objects and presented arguments to the court.
Court will not make any further bail modification at this time.

Defense waives time limits for Prelim.
  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for De Novo Review of Bail, filed by the State.
Hearing on June 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:38 PM Defendant Richard D Lefevre in court with attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court on Friday with his other cases.  The Court will reserve the right for the State to address bail at the next date and puts parties on notice that bail may be addressed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
